author: Sophia Thomas
title: Organizers say local Free Palestine Movement is growing
text:
BURLINGTON, Vt. (WCAX) - On one of the coldest days this winter, hundreds gathered outside City Hall in Burlington to call for a ceasefire in Gaza.
Protestors chanted for a free Palestine, condemning U.S. aid to Israel and Burlington City Council’s recent standstill on a ceasefire resolution . There were old and new faces in the crowd. It was University of Vermont freshman Lilly Patton’s first Free Palestine rally.
“I think it was time I step in and also support it,” Patton said.
Burlington resident Emma Kouri came with her daughter and her friends. Kouri says she wanted to go beyond simply discussing the conflict.
“There’s a lot of talk about what’s happening and awareness but I don’t feel like there’s enough of a push as there should be and really us putting our physical bodies out there on the line to support the community,” Kouri said.
Over three months since Hamas attacked Israel, local organizers say the Free Palestine movement is growing.
Wafic Faour with Vermonters for Justice in Palestine is the backbone of the local movement. He’s noticed more people getting involved and educating themselves since the initial attack.
“Our movement in Burlington here is in hundreds and hundreds and we’re hearing from many people and quarters and organization that for the longest time we never heard from,” Faour reflected.
Faour hopes people think beyond the protest, writing their representatives and boycotting companies that support Israel.
The rally ended with a march past TD Bank, under fire for holding millions in stocks in General Dynamics, an aerospace and weapons company supplying Israel’s army. Organizers say next up is a rally on Monday ahead of Burlington City Council’s final vote on a ceasefire resolution.

author: @gurufocus
title: CoreWeave (CRWV) Sees Stock Surge After Initial IPO; BlackBerry (BB) Declines
text:
Summary:
- CoreWeave (
CRWV,Financial) saw a significant uptick in stock value post-IPO, despite an underwhelming initial launch. - BlackBerry (BB) stock fell as the company forecasts a drop in annual revenue.
- Trump Media & Technology Group looks at potential stock sales, while NewsMax (NMAX) experiences a sharp decline after a strong post-IPO surge.
CoreWeave's Post-IPO Performance
CoreWeave (CRWV) has captured investors' attention with a remarkable climb in stock value, following its initial public offering. Despite a modest debut, the rally suggests strong investor interest and an optimistic outlook for the company's future prospects. As market dynamics shift, CoreWeave seems poised to leverage its strategic initiatives to maintain momentum.
BlackBerry's Revenue Forecast and Stock Impact
In a contrasting narrative, BlackBerry (BB) shares witnessed a decline after the company revised its annual revenue projections downward. The anticipated decrease is attributed to reduced spending on cybersecurity solutions, which has impacted investor confidence. BlackBerry's pivot may indicate broader market trends affecting the cybersecurity industry.
Trump Media & Technology Group Evaluates Stock Sale
Meanwhile, Trump Media & Technology Group faced a downturn as it filed documents potentially paving the way for the sale of President Trump's stake in the company. This move might significantly alter the ownership landscape, with potential implications for future stock performance and shareholder value.
NewsMax's Stock Volatility Post-IPO
NewsMax (NMAX) experienced pronounced stock volatility, characterized by a sharp decline following an impressive rise after its IPO. This pattern underscores the unpredictable nature of post-IPO trading, raising questions about the company's long-term market stability and investor sentiment.
topics: Economy, Business and Finance->business reporting and performance

author: FOX26Houston
title: Oscar Mayer turkey bacon recalled for possible listeria contamination
text:
Kraft Heinz is recalling nearly 368,000 pounds of Oscar Mayer turkey bacon products over potential listeria contamination. No illnesses have been reported so far.
Turkey bacon lovers might want to check their fridge.Kraft Heinz Foods has recalled hundreds of thousands of pounds of Oscar Mayer Turkey Bacon Original due to possible contamination with Listeria monocytogenes, a bacteria that can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections. The affected products were shipped nationwide and internationally, but no confirmed illnesses have been reported, according to federal food safety officials.
Key details about the recall and safety risks have been confirmed by federal and company officials:Several questions remain unanswered as the investigation continues:Listeria can cause life-threatening illness, especially in pregnant people, newborns, older adults, and those with weakened immune systems. Symptoms include fever, muscle aches, confusion, and even convulsions in severe cases.According to the CDC, about 1,600 people in the U.S. get sick from listeria each year, and around 260 die.

author: ETtoday新聞雲
title: 支援嘉義災後家園重建　基隆環保局重機具緊急南下
text:
▲基隆清潔隊攜重裝備疾馳，助嘉義災後72小時黃金搶修。（圖／記者郭世賢翻攝，下同）
記者郭世賢／基隆報導
今年第4號颱風「丹娜絲」挾帶強風豪雨重創台灣西南部地區，嘉義縣首當其衝，市區多處傳出淹水、樹倒與路面坍塌等嚴重災情。基隆市政府秉持「全台一家親」的精神，在環境部環管署的協調下，市長謝國樑指示環保局火速組成支援團隊，昨（9日）下午攜帶抓斗車、鏟裝機、鏈鋸機等機具及專業清潔人員，南下嘉義縣，全力協助當地展開災後復建與環境清理工作。
根據中央氣象署資料顯示，「丹娜絲」颱風自生成以來即呈現強烈發展態勢，過去24小時對南部地區帶來驚人雨勢。嘉義縣在風雨夾擊下，樹木倒塌阻礙交通，民宅與公共設施積水不退，垃圾與漂流物堆積於街道、排水系統嚴重堵塞，清理與復建工作迫在眉睫。
面對災情，嘉義縣政府已動員地方各單位全力搶修與復原，並啟動區域支援機制，向中央與各地方政府請求協助。在環境部的協調下，基隆市政府在第一時間回應，市長謝國樑強調災害無分你我，去年颱風重創基隆，許多縣市也協助基隆渡過難關。基隆市環保局立即整備所需資源，展開跨縣市支援行動。
基隆市環保局長馬仲豪表示，本次支援隊伍由曹宏儒區隊長帶隊，另有8名經驗豐富的清潔人員，並動員具重型作業能力的清運與清理機具，包括3部抓斗車、1部鏟裝機、10部鏈鋸機與相關後勤物資。這些設備將針對道路障礙清除、大型漂流物處理、倒木切割搬運與淤泥垃圾清運等災後重建工作進行支援。
局長馬仲豪指出，基隆市平日即有面對風災與山區落石、倒木的防災經驗，因此本次支援團隊成員皆有相關實作經驗，可立即投入災區高效率協助清理。相信和嘉義縣環保局緊密協調，分工合作，能以最快速度協助當地恢復市容與正常生活機能。
本次支援任務預計將在嘉義縣進行為期3至5天的重點清理作業，若災情持續或復建工作需求延長，基隆市也不排除持續派遣後續梯次支援團隊，展現地方政府在防救災體系中的即時應變與互助精神。

author: Caleb Wethington
title: Firefighters rescue residents after laundry room fire at Murfreesboro assisted living tower
text: After the building was cleared of smoke, all those evacuated were able to return. MURFREESBORO, Tenn. (WSMV) - Firefighters were able to rescue residents from an assisted living tower in Murfreesboro after a fire in the tower’s laundry room. Murfreesboro Fire Rescue said crews went floor to floor assisting residents out of the Westbrook Towers after a laundry room fire sent smoke billowing through the building on Friday morning. First responders were alerted of the fire at the seven-story building on N. Walnut Street at just before 10:30 a.m. Crews were able to quickly extinguish the fire and contain it in the laundry room. No injuries were reported. “Fire crews went throughout the building several times assisting about a third of the residents, some using wheelchairs and walkers, with getting out safely. Many others left the building when the fire alarm sounded. Some residents sheltered in place in stairways where there was no smoke,” MFRD said. A nearby center, St. Clair Senior Center opened its doors for residents to escape the heat outside. After the building was cleared of smoke, all those evacuated were able to return. The cause of the fire is under investigation. Copyright 2024 WSMV. All rights reserved.

La persecución y destrucción de un obispo antinazi acusado de pederastia en la España de Franco
eldiario.es
Se cumple medio siglo desde la muerte de Fidel García Martínez (Soto y Amío, León, 1880-Logroño, La Rioja, 1973), que fue obispo de la diócesis de Calahorra-La Calzada y una de las figuras más peculiares, y relevantes, de la Iglesia católica española del siglo pasado. Víctima de persecución por el franquismo, por su decidido antinazismo y su reticencia con el régimen, también lo fue por prostituir a mujeres.
